{"step_by_step_thinking": "According to the relevant documents, the fusion of the palatine process begins during the development of the secondary palate. Document [2] states that the fusion of the medial nasal prominences to form the median palatine process or the primary palate is complete around week twelve. Document [24] also mentions that fusion of the palatal shelves to form the secondary palate is completed by the tenth week and fully forms by the twelfth week of embryonic development. Therefore, the fusion of the palatine process begins at the 10th week and is completed by the 12th week of fertilization.", "answer_choice": "C. 10th week of fertilization"}
